item.title: Investigating Weird Result Times in Benchmark.NET
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: TL;DR I’ve spent the past year or so by way of 100 collective hours wrestling with a JIT-related code alignment issue which is now being tracked on both the Benchmark.

item.title: Thoughts on //build 2018 and Why ScottGu Should be MSFT CEO
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: Brushing Off the Dust Alright, a lot has been happening in the world lately and I have felt the need to brush off this blog and share some thoughts of mine that have collected over the past few months and weeks.

item.title: Where Are the Vote Reports?
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: You’ve probably noticed that the vote reports have stopped here on Developers.win. Unless of course you don’t care about them, then you haven’t noticed them at all. üôÇ These of course were a side project of mine based on the Xaml-console based application that ran on a weekly basis, tallying the latest vote totals from numerous Microsoft UserVoice forums.

item.title: Why an HTML5-Compliant .NET is Important
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: TL;DR: Vote! Exploring an HTML5-Compliant .NET I recently got a good question on the .NET Foundation Forums in regard to why I (and nearly 5,200 other votes as of this writing) feel so strongly about having an HTML5-compliant .

item.title: Speak Up
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: Yesterday marked the 6th month mark of the premiere vote of Developers.win. In this time, over 2700 votes have been accounted towards the idea of a ubiquitous .NET client application development model.

item.title: Exploring Microsoft‚Äôs Xamarin Acquisition with 7 Simple Graphics
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: TL;DR: Vote! The purpose of this article is to build consensus around a ubiquitous .NET client application development model. With Xamarin’s acquisition yesterday, this gets us closer, but not quite there.

item.title: For Your Review: We Are Under Review!
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: Wat Is It? Yesterday¬†at around 3:30 PM PT/ 6:30 PM ET, the Visual Studio team marked the premiere idea that this site was built around,¬†Create a Ubiquitous .

item.title: How NodeJS Is Dominating .NET in 3 Easy Charts
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: Wat Now? OK I have to admit my title to this article is my first attempt at click bait. Hey, I’m learning my new toy here, what can I say?

item.title: Is the Tide Turning on project.json?
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: Wat Want? I am not exactly a¬†fan of the new project.json initiative underway between¬†the Visual Studio and ASP.NET Core rewrite. In fact, I have been so concerned with¬†it that I have created a vote to change this very issue¬†along with¬†other latent misgivings in the Visual Studio project system.

item.title: The .NET Exodus to NodeJS: Sound Off
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: What Want? Are you a NodeJS developer? More importantly, are you a former or current .NET developer? Are you a .NET developer thinking of making the switch to NodeJS?

item.title: The Great .NET Client Divide: A Simple Example (Hopefully)
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: TL;DR: Vote! I have been getting some good feedback on writing lengthy blog articles. Right right. I try to be aware and respectful of your time. And mine, too. At the end of the day I am just some random developer that you don’t know who happens to put their thoughts on the web — and I try to keep that in mind.

item.title: Eight Weeks, 1,000+ Votes, #1 Hottest Vote ‚Äî THANK YOU!!!
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: “Amazing! WOW! Incredible!” Those are a few of the words that sit in my head this morning. When I set out to make this site over six¬†months ago, I really didn’t have any expectations or know what to expect.

item.title: Hello World! (again)
item.author: run@superdotnet.run (Mike-EEE)
item.description: I am very happy to announce the first posting on this blog! This has been an effort that has taken a few weeks now. As with anything dealing with software, it is never as easy as initially perceived, and has taken much longer than anticipated.
